result.execSummary:
The defendant Dani L. Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dani L. Hicks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dani L. Hicks was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).
  • Dani L. Hicks was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing After Revocation - 04/03/2018

10:10 a.m. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Dani L. Hicks in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Sowinski/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Each Count - CC to each other and CC to any current sentence
Wisconsin State Prison - 5 years
Initial Confinement - 2 years
Extended Supervision - 3 years
Jail credit - 149 days


Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program
Appeal rights given. WEDS given.
Court remits any unpaid financial obligations. 
Adj. 10:31 a.m.
from Taycheedah
to transport
includes revocation packet and cover letter
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 3, 2018 at 10:00 am.

No use or possession of any medications not prescribed and only in dosage and manner as prescribed. Must attend all court hearings. Cooperate with all PSI requirements to obtain report.

3:50 p.m. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf60 and 15cm465 (review hearing). Sowinski/Richards statement to agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 2 and 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI report to be completed by no recommendation as to sentence but include all other information. Sowinski - statement to release from custody on September 27, 2016 - motion to modify to cash bail. Richards statement. Court modifies signature bond to add conditions.  Adj. 4:03 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

2:27 p.m. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Mary Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm465 and 16cf60. Sowinski did not transport defendant - requests new date. Bail continued. Adj. 2:29 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

3:08 p.m. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Dani L. Hicks in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf60 (arraignment) and 15cm465 (review hearing). Richards - in receipt of Information - waive further reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bail continued. 15cm465 review of fines to track. Adj. 3:11 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:21 p.m. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Dani L. Hicks in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15cm465, 15cm111, 16cf60. In 16cf60, Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Arraignment/Pre-Trial conference Tuesday July 19, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.
In 15cm111, all parties in receipt of revocation packet. Klemm/Richards/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 120 days With Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 79 days
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment Restitution to be reduced to civil judgment - restitution information to be provided to Clerk of Court. 
Appeal rights given.

15cm465 - Scheduled for review hearing on July 19, 2016. On May 16, 2016 Attorney Mary Burns was in court - Attorney Burns acknowledged receipt of complaint and matter was set for pre-trial - No initial appearance was necessary. Attorney Burns was mistaken and minutes should reflect new information. 
Bail continued in 16cf60.
Adj. 3:39 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery   -cover letter
Case not called
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court via video with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Dani L. Hicks in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Laska moves to withdraw as counsel - failure of attorney/client relationship - has made PD's office aware of need for new counsel - PD's office is looking for new counsel - Motion to withdraw granted. Bail continued. Adj. 1:36 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
defendant/JA
JA/Defendant's parents
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

3:14 p.m. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court via video with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appearing specially for Attorney Cana Laska.  Defendant Dani L. Hicks in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail continued. Adj. 3:15 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

1:29 p.m. Court Commissioner Galen Bayne-Allison. Defendant Dani L. Hicks in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be provided, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $5000 sig bond. Adj. 1:34 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
